image.altText: Four people walking amongst streets with new builds behind them

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton prepare for a sprint to the election finish line, some South Australians could be questioning if their state is part of the race.

title.children: Does South Australia matter this federal election?

image.altText: Nathan Brown promotes a multi bet on television.

props.synopsis: The Sportsbet "live odds" segments hosted by former player Nathan Brown was an AFL television broadcast mainstay for years. Why have they suddenly stopped?

title.children: After the losses were revealed, these Sportsbet TV segments stopped

image.altText: Image of thick vines with grapes on them.

props.synopsis: Once almost lost, these fragile old vines are now the focus of DNA testing and efforts to preserve Australia's oldest vineyards.

title.children: Australia's wine roots run a lot deeper than you think

image.altText: The central business district of Port Augusta with wind turbines in the distance.

props.synopsis: Port Augusta is one of seven locations across the country earmarked to host nuclear power plants if the Coalition wins the federal election, but the community has mixed views on the proposal.

title.children: Nuclear power is earmarked for Port Augusta, but reactions are mixed

image.altText: A red-headed woman with glasses sits near a playground.

props.synopsis: There are calls for more funding to be made available to local governments to help maintain footpath networks and improve accessibility for people living with disabilities.

title.children: Dodgy footpaths wreaking havoc for people living with disability

image.altText: A bilby.

props.synopsis: Years of fires, landclearing and introduced predators have seen Australia's bilby population plummet but a glimmer of hope exists within six protected areas.

title.children: Sacrificing sleep to search for bilbies under the stars

image.altText: A woman looks at her baby who she is holding aloft for the camera

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party holds the seat of Sturt on an ultra-thin margin. This is what voters are saying in the inner eastern suburbs electorate.

title.children: The talk on the street in South Australia's most marginal seat

image.altText: Giants AFL players look dejected after walking from the field.

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs steamroll GWS by 32 points to notch their first back-to-back wins of the season, while Port Adelaide and the Brisbane Lions also taste victory.

title.children: Dejected Giants 'got some things to work out' after falling to Bulldogs

image.altText: a cute dog

props.synopsis: The miniature dachshund who disappeared a year-and-a-half ago has been captured, wildlife rescuers say.

title.children: Valerie the dachshund 'fit and well' after 529 days on Kangaroo Island

image.altText: photo taken through gap from inside building shows cars and the floor covered with pigeon excrement and feathers

props.synopsis: Locals in a South Australian town known for its silo art fear visitors are being driven away by the "toxic" smell created by hundreds of pigeons roosting in a derelict building.

title.children: Country town furious over 'pigeon palace' poo problem

image.altText: an older woman with short blonde/grey hair in an apron standing in front of a commercial coffee machine

props.synopsis: At 64, Jan Lawlor is not your typical fast-food worker. While some women her age are in the workforce out of financial need, Jan is working for the love of it.

title.children: 'Nanny' works in youth-dominated fast food industry because she loves it

image.altText: Former South Australian Liberal leader David Speirs walks away.

props.synopsis: Less than nine months ago, David Speirs held one of South Australia's most prominent and important jobs: the state's alternative premier and leader of the Liberal Party. Now, those titles have been replaced by "convicted drug supplier".

title.children: David Speirs has gone from alternative SA premier to convicted drug supplier

image.altText: A son and father stand next to each other and smile.

props.synopsis: As 94-year-old Australian war veteran Patrick Forbes prepares for his final Anzac Day march, he reflects back on his family's history of service which saw three members awarded the distinguished Military Cross.

title.children: Final Anzac Day march for veteran from three-time Military Cross family

image.altText: A farmer looks to the sky with machinery in the background.

props.synopsis: Anzac Day marks the traditional start for planting winter crops, but this year farmers are hoping for rain as they begin planting their crops in the dry.

title.children: Aussie farmers' grain gamble as rain fails to arrive before Anzac Day

image.altText: A woman sits with a typewriter on a brown wooden table.

props.synopsis: Pam Ashman has sat courtside for thousands of netball games, keeping score by hand and recording fixtures on her typewriter. Despite the painstaking work, the 78-year-old volunteer vows to "never ever" use a computer.

title.children: It takes Pam a month to typewrite sporting fixtures, but she loves it

image.altText: A sign saying Women's and Children's Hospital and public car park

props.synopsis: The personal data of more than 2,000 inpatients involved sleep studies at the Women's and Children's Hospital in Adelaide since 2018 has been accessed in a ransomware attack, with those affected being warned of identity theft risks.

title.children: Data of more than 2,000 SA patients hacked in ransomware attack

image.altText: A man with a blonde beard wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: WARNING: This story contains details that readers may find distressing. The family of a baby who died 42 hours after being "violently shaken" by his father has been left with "silence, grief and an emptiness that will never fully go away", a court has heard.

title.children: Family tells court of ongoing pain over death of 'innocent, defenceless' baby

image.altText: A concept image of two workers in high-vis walking past a row of large batteries.

props.synopsis: A large battery project in South Australia sells for nearly $500 million as investment in renewable energy surges.

title.children: Millions invested in big batteries amid net zero transition

image.altText: A man with pointy hair and maroon t-shirt smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A man accused of the shooting murder of South Australian police officer Jason Doig has been found mentally incompetent by the state's Supreme Court.

title.children: Man charged over SA police officer's death found mentally incompetent

image.altText: A woman sitting down next to dogs.

props.synopsis: A group of Australian pet owners who say their dogs suffered adverse effects or died after receiving an osteoarthritis treatment are working to launch a class action, after a lawsuit was filed in the United States.

title.children: Pet owners consider class action over osteoarthritis drug

image.altText: Gloved hands holding COVID-19 vaccine, needle in glass container.

props.synopsis: Three local councils in South Australia have been passing motions questioning vaccines, but health experts say they are based on misinformation and heighten community risk.

title.children: Councils under fire for promoting vaccine scepticism

image.altText: Harry McKay of the Blues celebrates a goal

props.synopsis: Carlton has won three straight after starting the season with four consecutive losses, toppling Geelong by 18 points at the MCG.

title.children: Carlton continues resurgence with upset over Geelong, Hawks back to winning ways

image.altText: Pallbearers carrying a coffin

props.synopsis: Pope Francis may have been a humble man beloved by Catholics around the world, but his funeral was still a star-studded affair. These were the key moments you missed.

title.children: The pope's funeral featured royals, mourners and a surprise meeting

image.altText: Crowds attend an anti-salmon rally in Hobart

props.synopsis: Opponents of salmon farming addressed a packed Hobart Parliament House lawn to rally against the state's salmon industry, following a mass mortality event over summer.

title.children: Crowds fill Hobart's Parliament House lawns to rally against salmon industry

image.altText: A composite image of three women and a man

props.synopsis: The ABC revisited American voters from across the political spectrum about their thoughts and feelings almost 100 days into Trump's second term.

title.children: We met them before Trump 2.0. Here's what these Americans think now

image.altText: Three men wearing royal blue and yellow prison uniforms stand next to each other with their hands cuffed

props.synopsis: Football teammates from Utah become cellmates in a foreign prison after allegedly joining rebel forces in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title.children: How three young Americans allegedly conspired to overthrow a foreign government

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: NT police are looking for two men who attacked a service station worker in Alice Springs on Sunday morning, less than four days after a Darwin shop owner was fatally stabbed.

title.children: Alice Springs service station worker stabbed, offenders at large

image.altText: Jack Robinson, holding the Australian flag above his head, sitting on the shoulder of supporters after winning at Bells Beach

props.synopsis: Aussies Isabella Nichols and Jack Robinson have completed one of the finest days in Australian surfing, claiming the women's and men's finals at Bells Beach.

title.children: Nichols and Robinson win Bells Beach crowns to complete Aussie double

image.altText: A sepia-tinged photo of a man holding a large crocodile.

props.synopsis: A crocodile wrangler from the country may sound like an unlikely advocate for LGBTQIA+ Australians in parliament. But Warren Entsch is just that — and it all started in a pub.

title.children: The out-of-the-blue reunion in a purple pub that changed Australia

image.altText: Woman wearing red plaid shirt standing in covered patio.

props.synopsis: Can one partner meet all of our emotional and sexual needs? Meet the polyamorous Australians questioning relationship norms, and redefining what love and loyalty looks like.

title.children: Polyamory is becoming more common, but it can still carry stigma and shame

image.altText: A silhouette of Lai, showing the damage to his limbs.

props.synopsis: It's been 50 years since the end of the war in Vietnam but an area "the size of Tasmania" is still grappling with unexploded bombs.

title.children: These explosives keep on killing 50 years after the Vietnam War

image.altText: A woman in a swimsuit on a boat

props.synopsis: Queensland tourism officials are harking back to the 1980s with a campaign based on a cover of Madonna's hit Holiday to tempt people back to the state.

title.children: Queensland tourism campaign taps nostalgia with Madonna hit

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Kylie Sanders was killed outside her Yarrawonga home after she tried to intervene in an argument, police say.

title.children: Police say woman died trying to help in neighbourhood fight

image.altText: A gas flare with a line graph indicating gas prices

props.synopsis: Gas has been making lots of headlines throughout this election campaign. As we enter the final week, there are a few things to know about gas, how much of it we use, and what role it plays in our power bills.

title.children: We use very little gas, but it has an outsized effect on our bills

image.altText: orange red and black smoke bellow from a port after an explosion

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for Iran's crisis management organisation said there had been prior warnings over the containment of the chemicals at the port.

title.children: Death toll rises after suspected chemical explosion at Iranian port
